title: type: null throws an error
body:
<!-- Please don't delete this template because we'll close your issue -->
<!-- Before creating an issue please make sure you are using the latest version of webpack. -->

# Bug report

<!-- Please ask questions on StackOverflow or the webpack Gitter. -->
<!-- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask?tags=webpack -->
<!-- https://gitter.im/webpack/webpack -->
<!-- Issues which contain questions or support requests will be closed. -->

**What is the current behavior?**

Create a `package.json` with `"type": null` and this will throw:

```
TypeError: Cannot read property 'startsWith' of null
    at Object.fn (/home/guybedford/Projects/ncc/node_modules/webpack/lib/rules/RuleSetCompiler.js:228:20)
    at execRule (/home/guybedford/Projects/ncc/node_modules/webpack/lib/rules/RuleSetCompiler.js:94:22)
    at execRule (/home/guybedford/Projects/ncc/node_modules/webpack/lib/rules/RuleSetCompiler.js:120:6)
    at Object.exec (/home/guybedford/Projects/ncc/node_modules/webpack/lib/rules/RuleSetCompiler.js:139:6)
    at /home/guybedford/Projects/ncc/node_modules/webpack/lib/NormalModuleFactory.js:444:34
    at /home/guybedford/Projects/ncc/node_modules/webpack/lib/NormalModuleFactory.js:119:11
    at /home/guybedford/Projects/ncc/node_modules/webpack/lib/NormalModuleFactory.js:658:8
    at /home/guybedford/Projects/ncc/node_modules/webpack/lib/NormalModuleFactory.js:817:5
    at /home/guybedford/Projects/ncc/src/index.js:148:30
    at finishResolved (/home/guybedford/Projects/ncc/node_modules/webpack/node_modules/enhanced-resolve/lib/Resolver.js:278:11)
```


**If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce.**

Running a build of any module file in the same folder output into the same folder.

<!-- A great way to do this is to provide your configuration via a GitHub repository -->
<!-- The most helpful is a minimal reproduction with instructions on how to reproduce -->
<!-- Repositories with too many files or large `webpack.config.js` files are not suitable -->
<!-- Please only add small code snippets directly into this issue -->
<!-- https://gist.github.com is a good place for longer code snippets -->
<!-- If your issue is caused by a plugin or loader, please create an issue on the loader/plugin repository instead -->

**What is the expected behavior?**

While this is an invalid value, it shouldn't fail the build.

<!-- "It should work" is not a helpful explanation -->
<!-- Explain exactly how it should behave -->

**Other relevant information:**
webpack version:  
Node.js version: 
Operating System: 
Additional tools:
